title: Kings Of Leon - Only By The Night [2CD - Bonus Live CD]

Kings of Leon return with the release of their highly anticipated fourth album &#039;Only By The Night&#039; on 22nd September through Columbia Records. &#039;Only By The Night&#039; is a bold and expansive sonic statement that looks set to solidify Kings of Leon&#039;s position as one of the most important international acts of 2008 and beyond. It follows rapidly in the footsteps of the bands previous albums &#039;Youth And Young Manhood&#039;, &#039;Aha Shake Heartbreak&#039; & &#039;Because Of The Times&#039;, which have quickly established them as one of the most prolific and acclaimed acts around. 

Despite a wave of criticism asserting that Kings of Leon&#039;s fourth full-length is "too commercial," Only by the Night may be the closest thing to a pitch-perfect album to drop in 2008. Granted, Tennessee&#039;s band of brothers (and one first cousin) takes a turn for the heavily polished here, but what the album lacks in rough-edged raunch, it more than makes up for in earnestness and--yes--stunning beauty. From the opening notes of "Closer" to the listing balladry of "Cold Desert," Only by the Night hardly misses a beat. Highlights abound, particularly in the trading off of melodic lines between instruments, and in this regard, bassist Jared Followill is the album&#039;s quiet MVP. Above these gorgeous instrumentals, singer Caleb emotes with a dramatic grit that never loses its command. A model of melodic rock composition, arranged and produced with a warm, inviting veneer, and performed with aching sincerity, these 11 tracks coalesce into a sanguine whole that eclipses the band&#039;s much-discussed rock posturing and yields more with every play. A good band&#039;s great album, Only by the Night (finally) establishes Kings of Leon as a rock act that worthy of seriously sustained attention.
